# Comparação entre dois grupos


::: {.cell hash='aula8_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-1_1a861289e1befdcdee870fd428e564ed'}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(tidyverse)
library(readxl)

mg <- read_excel("dados-diversos.xlsx","magnesio")

mg |> 
  ggplot(aes(trat, comp))+
  geom_jitter(width = 0.05)+
  geom_boxplot(fill = NA,
               outlier.colour = NA)+
  ylim(5,20)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](aula8_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-1-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::

::: {.cell hash='aula8_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-2_4fe474d8cc90b6053d57d47edf040dea'}

```{.r .cell-code}
#Para usar o t.test, organizar a tabela no formato largo, um nível do tratamento em uma coluna e outro em outra coluna
mg2 <- mg |> 
  #pega a coluna 1, ...
  pivot_wider(1,
              names_from = trat,
              values_from = comp)
mg2
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
# A tibble: 10 × 3
     rep   Mg2  Ctrl
   <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>
 1     1   9    13.7
 2     2  12.5  15.9
 3     3  10    15.7
 4     4   8    14.2
 5     5  13.2  15.9
 6     6  11    16.5
 7     7  10.8  18  
 8     8   9.5  14.4
 9     9  10.8  16.4
10    10  10.4  16  
```
:::
:::

::: {.cell hash='aula8_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-3_6b60d9d2d55f2a9eb731069bc6c7d79e'}

```{.r .cell-code}
#recebe o grupo mg e depois o grupo controle
#o $ liga o objeto mg2 a variável Mg2 da tabela no formato longo
t <- t.test(mg2$Mg2, mg2$Ctrl)

#resultado:df é grau de liberdade
```
:::

::: {.cell hash='aula8_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-4_f5777d2f814a65512968a9fd699e58f7'}

```{.r .cell-code}
mg |>
  ggplot(aes(trat, comp))+
  #erro padrão da média
  stat_summary(fun.data = "mean_se")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](aula8_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-4-1.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
library(report)
#sugestão para colocar no texto dos resultados
report(t)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
Effect sizes were labelled following Cohen's (1988) recommendations.

The Welch Two Sample t-test testing the difference between mg2$Mg2 and mg2$Ctrl
(mean of x = 10.52, mean of y = 15.68) suggests that the effect is negative,
statistically significant, and large (difference = -5.16, 95% CI [-6.49,
-3.83], t(17.35) = -8.15, p < .001; Cohen's d = -3.65, 95% CI [-5.12, -2.14])
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
mg |> 
  ggplot(aes(trat, comp))+
  geom_jitter(width = 0.05)+
  geom_boxplot(fill = NA,
               outlier.colour = NA)+
  ylim(5,20)+
  annotate(geom = "text",
           x = 0.7, y = 19,
           label = " t = 8.12; P < 0.001")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](aula8_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-4-2.png){width=672}
:::
:::
